derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English tǣsl, tǣsel, of West Germanic origin; related to tease

entry.def: A teasel is a plant with dry prickly flowers and leaves.

means.word_mean: 1. any of several herbs of the genus Dipsacus native to the Old World having flower heads surrounded by spiny bracts

auth_sentence.content: Soapwort used to be used to wash woollens, and teasel was used to tease up the nap of woollen clothes in medieval times.

auth_sentence.content: They can be easily seen in flight in meadows, sipping nectar from teasel, knapweed and buddleia.
